title: How does DNA work? How do chains of carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and phosphorus react to create something as complex as life? - Quora

response.answer_text: DNA or RNA don’t independently work to make complex life. They are more like blue prints or hard drives in which information is stored to execute a program. Many other things such as enzymes collectively forms a system(guided by chemistry) to make the complex life.  (I have said it very briefly, the system is very huge and fascinating to incorporate into a single answer)
